msgSnippet: Assert true on CollectionUtils#isEmpty() from Jakarta Commons if you want to catch the NPE as a Failure as opposed to an Error. You ll still need to fix it,

Subject: Re: [junit] how to unit test the complex query statement
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=231973488

Assert true on CollectionUtils#isEmpty() from Jakarta Commons if you 
want to catch the NPE as a Failure as opposed to an Error. You'll still 
need to fix it, mind!
--
Stephen Smith, MEng (Wales).
http://www.stephen-smith.co.uk/

Robert Wenner wrote:
> Hi,
> 
>> For eg: I want to test one method which will execute a complex query 
>> and returns a list of records.
>>         the size of the return list may vary.
> 
> Why does the search result vary?
> Don't you set up the data base with exactly the content you need?
> 
>> In testcase I coded like this
>>
>>    List  myList = dao.findAll();
>>   assertTrue("No records found",myList .size() >0)
> 
> Your test shows a problem in your code.
> It returns null instead of an empty list.
> Congratulations!
> Now you can fix the code.
> 
> Cheers,
> 
> Robert
subject: Re: [junit] how to unit test the complex query statement
